comment: If you do not LOVE reading difficult material please do not take this professor. Only a midterm, final, group DBL  and discussion posts. Not enough room to mess up on anything.
Good professor and provides decent feedback. Overall an easy class and you will surly pass as long as you try.

This class was so extremely helpful! Professor Ghadge provided us with so many tips about resumes, job hunting and interviews, etc. Professor Ghadge was also lenient and easy to communicate with. I would definitely take one of his classes again!!

Dr. Ghadge was a very fair professor. I just finished his 4 week summer class and received an A. The work he asks for is very fair and not overbearing at all, but not effortless so you actually learn. I really enjoyed him and his feedback!

Took him for a 100% online class, so I cant speak on how he is in lecture setting. Online,each week is a chapter from the textbook, a powerpoint to read through, a discussion post, & an online quiz. Only 2 exams the whole semester. Answers to exams and quizzes are on quizlet. Easy A AND you learn a lot, which is a rare combo. 10/10 would recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Ghadge is probably my favorite professor I've had. He gave amazing feedback on work and gave really good ways to improve your grade. He gave multiple opportunities for extra credit. He really wanted to get the class involved with the school and to participate in anything. We had many guest speakers. Overall, just an amazing teacher.

He's a good professor for an online class. I took the summer course and there are two discussions and two quizzes due each week. quizzes are easy, discussions are participation grades. Only two papers and one project assignment. Only complaint is that he grades extremely slow. It's the fifth week and he has only graded one assignment.

I was a part of the Year of India learning community and had to take this class and an additional course. Ravi is a cool dude who talks a lot. He does attendance 3 minutes before class, so if you're not in the door by then, you'll be marked absent. Every week, there is an online quiz, but all answers can be found through quizlets.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: In Ravi's class, we were expected to take a 20 question quiz almost every weekend based on the chapter reading from the book. However, most of them had Quizlets that told the answers. Again, the tests are easily passable if you study the vocabulary terms and their meanings. Good discussions and lots of lecture.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Ravi is very pationate about the subject so that makes it easier to pay attention. The majority of the class is just PowerPoints but he does throw in videos sometimes. There are online quizzes every week but they are super easy especially since you can just look up the answers. Tests are straightforward and he tells you what to study for.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Only grades are weekly discussion posts and quiz for each chapter, as well as midterm and final. Most quizzes are on Quizlet, but there are a few that you actually had to know the information. Midterm & final 100questions in 2 hours. Kind of hard. It's the last week of the semester and he hasn't graded discussions since the 3rd week of school.
Easy class if you do the work on time, would recommend.

3 unit tests, no final no homework no quizzes. Easy if you study. Long lectures but not showing up won't hurt grade even tho attendance is taken. Blames a lot on white people for world problems and very politically correct but take him anyway. Material very one sided but worth it. Don't be afraid to debate, he's cool about it. helpful outside class
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: i came to class maybe 3 times this semester, and was not penalized for anything (even though he does have a sheet where he takes attendance) the only 3 grades he puts in are your 3 exams which aren't hard if you read your textbook, look at his powerpoints online and read the study guide he gives you. study guides really help for the test. take him.

This was a relatively easy summer class. There is one quiz over three chapters each week, which includes a midterm and a final. Each week consists of reading 3 chapters, writing 2 discussion posts/chapter, 3 internet activities, and a quiz. This class is do-able if you commit to the work. I recommend taking this class online!

I took his 4 week online summer class. It's a lot of work, but if you follow the rubric he gives at the beginning of the semester, you will get an easy A. One module per week with 3 chapters. Each chapter you write 2 discussion posts and one internet activity. 2 quizzes, midterm, and a final exam.

Professor Ghadge was great. If you're interested in sociology, you'll find his lectures and videos super interesting. If not, you'll still appreciate how thorough he is. You can only miss 3 classes a semester without penalty. He says textbook use is mandatory but I never read it. He cares about his students & is kind. Makes awesome study guides.

receptive! cares a lot. Gives a lot of work, but is an easy class. Boring but tells you everything you need to know. We changed in class exams to essay exams mid semester. two responses to reading every week and four essays, but less stressful b/c no tests and also- offers extra credit in both classes ive had with him. can miss up to 3 days.

Dr. Ghadge is a good professor. His study guides are really helpful for the exams. 3 exams and no final exam. He gives 2 extra credits which are really helpful. One movie review and an observation assignment. He is really nice and helpful.
